page.title: 17PITMASTON,ST CLEMENTS SCHOOL
page.content: The school opened in Pitmaston House (built in 1830s) Malvern Road, in 1948 to accommodate 23 children overspill from St John's school. The present number on role is 503, with 17 staff, occupying school buildings constructed in 1955 & 1971 behind Pitmaston House(now the Teacher's Centre) Ironically, 43 children came from St John's school in September 1984, following it's closure. {St.Clement's School}is an old foundation, having been opened in 1816 by the church from which it takes its name. Originally there were three departments, Infants, Junior boys and Junior Girls, but over the years they have been merged into a Primary School serving children from 3 to 11. It is now an aided school with 286 children and 10 staff.
